meanings.definition: To make something seem more glamorous or attractive than it really is.
meanings.sent1: She overglamorized her vacation photos on social media.
meanings.sent2: The magazine overglamorized the celebrity's lifestyle.
meanings.sent3: He overglamorized his cooking skills, but burnt the dinner.
meanings.sent4: The movie overglamorized the struggles of being a superhero.
meanings.sent5: The advertisement overglamorized the benefits of the product.

meanings.definition: To exaggerate the attractiveness or importance of something.
meanings.sent1: The real estate agent overglamorized the small apartment.
meanings.sent2: Don't overglamorize your achievements during the interview.
meanings.sent3: She overglamorized her cat's hunting skills, but it only caught a toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The politician overglamorized his accomplishments to win votes.
meanings.sent5: The salesperson overglamorized the features of the car to make a sale.
